Objectives: Understand the basic structure of the dataset.
Identify initial patterns and relationships in the data.
Detect any obvious data quality issues.
Methods: Load the dataset and display the first few rows to get an initial sense of the data.
Use summary statistics to understand the distribution of numerical features.
Generate frequency tables for categorical features to understand their distribution.
Visualize the data using histograms, bar plots, and box plots to identify patterns and outliers.
Check for missing values and understand their distribution across the dataset.

NumericalData: Use summary statistics (mean, median, standard deviation, etc.) to understand the distribution.
Visualize using histograms and box plots to identify patterns and outliers.
CategoricalData: Generate frequency tables to understand the distribution.
Visualize using bar plots to identify patterns.

ProjectRequirementsAndResourceConstraint: Ensure that the analysis can be performed using available computational resources.
Keep the analysis simple and focused, avoiding overly complex methods at this stage.
Allocate sufficient time for each task to ensure thorough analysis without rushing.
